The photograph depicts Conrad Heyer: a veteran of the American Revolutionary War who served in 1777.
Conrad Heyer is believed to be the earli: born American photographed alive and the photograph is considered authentic.
Conrad Heyer was born in Waldoboro: Maine, in either 1749 or 1753, and was reputed to be the first white child born in the community.
Heyer served in the Continental Army for: December 1777. He later bought a farm in Waldoboro and lived there until his death in 1856, being buried with full military honors.
